infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov
Class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov

java.lang.Object
  infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov1, ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov2
public abstract class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
extends java.lang.Object

Compute the Conditional Mutual Information between two vectors, conditioned on a third, using the Kraskov estimation method, as extended by Frenzel and Pompe.

Computes this directly looking at the marginal space for each variable, rather than using the multi-info (or integration) in the marginal spaces. Two child classes actually implement the two algorithms in the Kraskov paper.

Author:
Joseph Lizier
See Also:
"Estimating mutual information", Kraskov, A., Stogbauer, H., Grassberger, P., Physical Review E 69, (2004) 066138, http://dx.doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevE.69.066138, "Partial Mutual Information for Coupling Analysis of Multivariate Time Series", Frenzel and Pompe, 2007 TODO Finish writing this class - changing it from original Kraskov one

setProperty

public void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                        java.lang.String propertyValue)
Sets properties for the calculator. Valid properties include:
  • PROP_K - number of neighbouring points in joint kernel space
  • PROP_NORM_TYPE
    • - normalization type to apply to working out the norms between the points in each marginal space. Options are defined by EuclideanUtils.setNormToUse(String) - default is EuclideanUtils.NORM_MAX_NORM.
  • PROP_NORMALISE - whether to normalise the individual variables (true by default)

Parameters:
propertyName - name of the property to set
propertyValue - value to set on that property

computeAverageLocalOfObservations

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

computeAverageLocalOfObservations

public abstract double computeAverageLocalOfObservations(int[] reordering)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Compute what the average conditional MI would look like were the second time series reordered as per the array of time indices in reordering. The user should ensure that all values 0..N-1 are represented exactly once in the array reordering and that no other values are included here.

Parameters:
reordering -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

computeSignificance

public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int numPermutationsToCheck)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Compute the significance of the mutual information of the previously supplied observations. We destroy the p(x,y,z) correlations, while retaining the p(x,z), p(y) marginals, to check how significant this conditional mutual information actually was. This is in the spirit of Chavez et. al., "Statistical assessment of nonlinear causality: application to epileptic EEG signals", Journal of Neuroscience Methods 124 (2003) 113-128 which was performed for Transfer entropy.

Parameters:
numPermutationsToCheck -
Returns:
the proportion of MI scores from the distribution which have higher or equal MIs to ours.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

computeSignificance

public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int[][] newOrderings)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Compute the significance of the mutual information of the previously supplied observations. We destroy the p(x,y,z) correlations, while retaining the p(x,z), p(y) marginals, to check how significant this mutual information actually was. This is in the spirit of Chavez et. al., "Statistical assessment of nonlinear causality: application to epileptic EEG signals", Journal of Neuroscience Methods 124 (2003) 113-128 which was performed for Transfer entropy.

Parameters:
newOrderings - the specific new orderings to use
Returns:
the proportion of conditional MI scores from the distribution which have higher or equal MIs to ours.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
